type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"NewsArticle","mainEntityOfPage":"https://www.timesnownews.com/lifestyle/bread-pakora-recipe-crispy-and-delicious-snack-to-enjoy-on-rainy-day-article-98960097","url":"https://www.timesnownews.com/lifestyle/bread-pakora-recipe-crispy-and-delicious-snack-to-enjoy-on-rainy-day-article-98960097","articleBody":"A popular Indian snack, bread pakora is loved by all. It is the perfect snack to enjoy during the rainy season with a cup of hot tea or coffee. There is a perfect balance of textures and flavours between the crispy outer layer and the soft bread and spicy filling of the pakora. The following recipe will show you how to make bread pakora at home.Bread Pakora RecipeIngredients:Bread slices (white or brown) - 8Chickpea flour (besan) - 1 cupRice flour - 2 tbspSalt - 1 tspRed chilli powder - 1 tspGaram masala - 1 tspAjwain (carom seeds) - 1 tspBaking soda - 1/2 tspWater - 1 cupOil - for fryingFor the filling:Potatoes - 2 (boiled and mashed)Green chillies - 2 (finely chopped)Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp (finely chopped)Cumin seeds - 1 tspSalt - 1/2 tspGaram masala - 1/2 tspAmchur powder (dry mango powder) - 1/2 tspHow to make Bread PakoraMake the filling by heating oil and adding cumin seeds. After the cumin seeds splutter, add the green chillies and sauté for a minute or two.Then add the mashed potatoes, salt, garam masala, and amchur powder. Combine well and cook for two to three minutes.Turn the heat off and add the coriander leaves. After mixing, let it cool for a few minutes.Slice the bread into halves and cut the edges off.Spread the filling on one side of a slice of bread.Put another slice on top and gently press the slices together.The same process should be repeated with all the slices of bread.Combine besan, rice flour, salt, red chilli powder, garam masala, ajwain, and baking soda in a bowl.To make a smooth batter, add water gradually and whisk.In a deep pan, heat the oil.Dip the bread sandwiches in the besan batter and thoroughly coat them.Place them gently in the hot oil (medium flame) and fry them until golden brown.After removing them from the oil, place them on kitchen towels to absorb excess grease.If you want, you can serve it hot with mint chutney or tomato ketchup.Tips:The filling can be made more nutritious by adding finely chopped onions, carrots, or peas.Don't let the filling become too wet, otherwise the bread will become soggy.Overcrowding the pan will result in uneven cooking of the pakoras.To conclude, bread pakora is a simple and delicious snack that can be made at home with a few simple ingredients. If you are craving something hot and crispy with your cup of tea or coffee on a rainy day, this is the perfect dish for you. Take a bite of bread pakora and indulge in its goodness.","datePublished":"2023-03-24T11:15:25+05:30","dateModified":"2023-03-24T11:15:25+05:30","articleSection":"Lifestyle","headline":"Bread Pakora Recipe: Crispy and delicious snack to enjoy on rainy day","keywords":"bread pakora,recipe,Bread pakora recipes,Lifestyle,snacks,","description":"Enjoy this delicious bread pakora recipe on a rainy day. class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">A popular Indian snack, <a id="1555182" type="General" weightage="20" keywordseo="bread-pakora" source="Orion" href="/topic/bread-pakora">bread pakora</a> is loved by all. It is the perfect snack to enjoy during the rainy season with a cup of hot tea or coffee. There is a perfect balance of textures and flavours between the crispy outer layer and the soft bread and spicy filling of the pakora. The following <a id="52676" type="General" weightage="20" keywordseo="recipe" source="Orion" href="/topic/recipe">recipe</a> will show you how to make bread pakora at home.</div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><h2></h2></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><h2>Bread Pakora Recipe</h2></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><strong>Ingredients:</strong></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><ul><li>Bread slices (white or brown) - 8</li><li>Chickpea flour (besan) - 1 cup</li><li>Rice flour - 2 tbsp</li><li>Salt - 1 tsp</li><li>Red chilli powder - 1 tsp</li><li>Garam masala - 1 tsp</li><li>Ajwain (carom seeds) - 1 tsp</li><li>Baking soda - 1/2 tsp</li><li>Water - 1 cup</li><li>Oil - for frying</li></ul></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><strong>For the </strong><strong>filling:</strong></div><div class="trinity-skip-it rdE5S _15-lE"><section class="_1qD1L"><strong>Related News</strong><div class="_1ewds"><a href="/lifestyle/vrat-ka-khana-how-to-make-kuttu-ki-puri-with-and-without-potato-a-step-by-step-guide-article-98906223" class="_3rMcl _2IF03" clink="y"><img src="https://static.tnn.in/photo/msid-88386381/88386381.jpg" data-src="https://static.tnn.in/photo/msid-98906223,imgsize-89660,updatedat-1679476247470,width-200,height-200,resizemode-75/98906223.jpg" style="object-fit:contain;object-position:center" alt="Vrat ka Khana How to make Kuttu ki Puri with and without potato A step-by-step guide" title=""/><p>Vrat ka Khana: How to make Kuttu ki Puri with and without potato: A step-by-step guide</p></a><a href="/lifestyle/sabudana-khichdi-recipe-a-delicious-and-nutritious-dish-to-serve-during-navratri-article-98932168" class="_3rMcl _2IF03" clink="y"><img src="https://static.tnn.in/photo/msid-88386381/88386381.jpg" data-src="https://static.tnn.in/photo/msid-98932168,imgsize-46384,updatedat-1679550019067,width-200,height-200,resizemode-75/98932168.jpg" style="object-fit:contain;object-position:center" alt="Sabudana Khichdi Recipe A delicious and nutritious dish to serve during Navratri" title=""/><p>Sabudana Khichdi Recipe: A delicious and nutritious dish to serve during Navratri</p></a></div></section></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><ul><li>Potatoes - 2 (boiled and mashed)</li><li>Green chillies - 2 (finely chopped)</li><li>Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp (finely chopped)</li><li>Cumin seeds - 1 tsp</li><li>Salt - 1/2 tsp</li><li>Garam masala - 1/2 tsp</li><li>Amchur powder (dry mango powder) - 1/2 tsp</li></ul><h3>How to make Bread Pakora</h3></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><ul><li>Make the filling by heating oil and adding cumin seeds. After the cumin seeds splutter, add the green chillies and sauté for a minute or two.</li><li>Then add the mashed potatoes, salt, garam masala, and amchur powder. Combine well and cook for two to three minutes.</li><li>Turn the heat off and add the coriander leaves. After mixing, let it cool for a few minutes.</li><li>Slice the bread into halves and cut the edges off.</li><li>Spread the filling on one side of a slice of bread.Put another slice on top and gently press the slices together.</li><li>The same process should be repeated with all the slices of bread.</li><li>Combine besan, rice flour, salt, red chilli powder, garam masala, ajwain, and baking soda in a bowl.</li><li>To make a smooth batter, add water gradually and whisk.</li><li>In a deep pan, heat the oil.</li><li>Dip the bread sandwiches in the besan batter and thoroughly coat them.</li><li>Place them gently in the hot oil (medium flame) and fry them until golden brown.</li><li>After removing them from the oil, place them on kitchen towels to absorb excess grease.</li><li>If you want, you can serve it hot with mint chutney or tomato ketchup.</li></ul><strong>Tips:</strong></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem"><ul><li>The filling can be made more nutritious by adding finely chopped onions, carrots, or peas.</li><li>Don't let the filling become too wet, otherwise the bread will become soggy.</li><li>Overcrowding the pan will result in uneven cooking of the pakoras.</li></ul></div><div class="trinity-skip-it rdE5S _15-lE"><section class="_1qD1L"><strong>Related News</strong><div class="_1ewds"><a href="/lifestyle/andhra-style-pulihora-recipe-quick-and-easy-step-by-step-guide-article-98865089" class="_3rMcl _2IF03" clink="y"><img src="https://static.tnn.in/photo/msid-88386381/88386381.jpg" alt="Andhra-style Pulihora recipe Quick and Easy  Step-by-step guide" title=""/><p>Andhra-style Pulihora recipe: Quick and Easy | Step-by-step guide</p></a></div></section></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:hidden;padding:10px 15px 0 15px"></div><div></div><div class="_18840" style="visibility:visible;padding:0px 15px 10px 15px;font-size:1rem">To conclude, bread pakora is a simple and delicious snack that can be made at home with a few simple ingredients. FDesktop\u002FArticleShow\u002FTN_English_Desk_AS_MID_2_Multisize"},"multi_3":{"divId":"div-u-id-1-10","size":[[980,200],[728,90]],"adCode":"\u002F21806551354\u002FTN_English\u002FDesktop\u002FArticleShow\u002FTN_English_Desk_AS_MID_3_Multisize"},"multi_4":{"divId":"div-u-id-1-11","size":[[980,200],[728,90]],"adCode":"\u002F21806551354\u002FTN_English\u002FDesktop\u002FArticleShow\u002FTN_English_Desk_AS_MID_INF_Multisize"}},"sections":{"article_show":{"widgetType":"article_show","categoryName":"article_show","listType":"detail","data":[{"msid":98960097,"parentid":88426250,"hostid":183,"text":"A popular Indian snack, bread pakora is loved by all. It is the perfect snack to enjoy during the rainy season with a cup of hot tea or coffee. There is a perfect balance of textures and flavours between the crispy outer layer and the soft bread and spicy filling of the pakora. The following recipe will show you how to make bread pakora at home.Bread Pakora RecipeIngredients:Bread slices (white or brown) - 8Chickpea flour (besan) - 1 cupRice flour - 2 tbspSalt - 1 tspRed chilli powder - 1 tspGaram masala - 1 tspAjwain (carom seeds) - 1 tspBaking soda - 1\u002F2 tspWater - 1 cupOil - for fryingFor the filling:Potatoes - 2 (boiled and mashed)Green chillies - 2 (finely chopped)Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp (finely chopped)Cumin seeds - 1 tspSalt - 1\u002F2 tspGaram masala - 1\u002F2 tspAmchur powder (dry mango powder) - 1\u002F2 tspHow to make Bread PakoraMake the filling by heating oil and adding cumin seeds. After the cumin seeds splutter, add the green chillies and sauté for a minute or two.Then add the mashed potatoes, salt, garam masala, and amchur powder. Combine well and cook for two to three minutes.Turn the heat off and add the coriander leaves. After mixing, let it cool for a few minutes.Slice the bread into halves and cut the edges off.Spread the filling on one side of a slice of bread.Put another slice on top and gently press the slices together.The same process should be repeated with all the slices of bread.Combine besan, rice flour, salt, red chilli powder, garam masala, ajwain, and baking soda in a bowl.To make a smooth batter, add water gradually and whisk.In a deep pan, heat the oil.Dip the bread sandwiches in the besan batter and thoroughly coat them.Place them gently in the hot oil (medium flame) and fry them until golden brown.After removing them from the oil, place them on kitchen towels to absorb excess grease.If you want, you can serve it hot with mint chutney or tomato ketchup.Tips:The filling can be made more nutritious by adding finely chopped onions, carrots, or peas.Don't let the filling become too wet, otherwise the bread will become soggy.Overcrowding the pan will result in uneven cooking of the pakoras.To conclude, bread pakora is a simple and delicious snack that can be made at home with a few simple ingredients. If you are craving something hot and crispy with your cup of tea or coffee on a rainy day, this is the perfect dish for you. Take a bite of bread pakora and indulge in its goodness.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Bread Pakora Recipe: Crispy and delicious snack to enjoy on rainy day","cmssource":"CMSLITE","parenttitle":"Lifestyle","titleforurl":"bread pakora recipe: crispy and delicious snack to enjoy on rainy day","synopsis":"Enjoy this delicious bread pakora recipe on a rainy day. It is a versatile ingredient that offers a number of benefits to hair, such as the reduction of dandruff, the stimulation of hair growth, and the improvement of the health of the scalp. The purpose of this article is to discuss the benefits of apple cider vinegar for hair and how it can be used.Benefits of Apple Cider Vinegar for Hair:Reduces Dandruff: The antimicrobial properties of apple cider vinegar can help reduce the appearance of dandruff. Furthermore, it helps to balance the pH level of the scalp, thereby preventing the growth of fungi that cause dandruff.Promotes Hair Growth: Apple cider vinegar contains acetic acid, which is known for its ability to improve blood circulation to the scalp, thereby promoting hair growth. Additionally, it has been shown to strengthen hair follicles, which can result in less hair loss.Improves Scalp Health: The acidity of apple cider vinegar helps remove buildup and residue from the scalp, promoting a healthy scalp. In addition, it aids in preventing hair loss by unclogging hair follicles.Adds Shine to Hair:The application of apple cider vinegar can assist in removing buildup from hair strands, which can lead to a dull and lifeless appearance. With apple cider vinegar, you can remove the buildup from your hair strands and make the hair shine and look healthier.How to Use Apple Cider Vinegar for Hair:Diluted Apple Cider Vinegar Rinse: In a spray bottle, combine equal parts of apple cider vinegar and water. As soon as you have finished washing your hair, spray the mixture onto your scalp and hair. Let it sit for five to ten minutes and then rinse it off with water. In this way, dandruff will be reduced and scalp health will be improved.Apple Cider Vinegar Hair Mask: You should mix 2-3 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar with one egg white and one tablespoon of honey. The mixture should be applied to the hair and scalp and left on for 30 minutes. It should be rinsed off with water and shampooed as usual. Hair growth can be stimulated and shine can be added to the hair with this mask.Apple Cider Vinegar and Baking Soda Shampoo: Combine one tablespoon of baking soda with 1-2 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar. You should wet your hair and apply the mixture to your scalp, massaging it gently. You should then rinse it off with water and shampoo as usual. By doing this, you will be able to remove buildup and residue from your hair strands, resulting in healthier-looking hair.ACV Precautions:It is not recommended to apply undiluted apple cider vinegar directly to your hair and scalp in order to prevent irritation and damage.If you have any concerns about allergies, always conduct a patch test before applying apple cider vinegar to your hair.The use of apple cider vinegar too frequently can cause hair to become dry and damaged.The use of apple cider vinegar may affect the colour of colour-treated hair, so it is recommended that you consult with a hair care professional before using it.There are many benefits to using apple cider vinegar for hair care that are natural and cost-effective. Dandruff can be reduced, hair growth can be increased, and scalp health can be improved by using it. Following the right precautions and using apple cider vinegar in the right way will ensure that your hair is healthier and shinier.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"Apple Cider Vinegar for Hair: 4 benefits and how to use ACV for shiny and healthy hair","cmssource":"CMSLITE","parenttitle":"Lifestyle","titleforurl":"apple cider vinegar for hair: 4 benefits and how to use acv for shiny and healthy hair","synopsis":"Apple cider vinegar is a natural remedy that can improve scalp health, reduce dandruff, and add shine to hair. With apple cider vinegar, you can remove the buildup from your hair strands and make the hair shine and look healthier.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003C\u002Fol\u003E","paraLength":3,"showRelatedFlag":true,"adsIndex":2},{"htmlText":"\u003Ch2\u003EHow to Use Apple Cider Vinegar for Hair:\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E","paraLength":4,"showRelatedFlag":true,"adsIndex":2},{"paraLength":4,"showRelatedFlag":false,"adsIndex":2},{"htmlText":"\u003Col\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EDiluted Apple Cider Vinegar Rinse:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E In a spray bottle, combine equal parts of apple cider vinegar and water. As soon as you have finished washing your hair, spray the mixture onto your scalp and hair. Let it sit for five to ten minutes and then rinse it off with water. In this way, dandruff will be reduced and scalp health will be improved.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EApple Cider Vinegar Hair Mask:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E You should mix 2-3 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar with one egg white and one tablespoon of honey. The mixture should be applied to the hair and scalp and left on for 30 minutes. It should be rinsed off with water and shampooed as usual. Hair growth can be stimulated and shine can be added to the hair with this mask.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003E\u003Cstrong\u003EApple Cider Vinegar and Baking Soda Shampoo:\u003C\u002Fstrong\u003E Combine one tablespoon of baking soda with 1-2 tablespoons of apple cider vinegar. You should wet your hair and apply the mixture to your scalp, massaging it gently. You should then rinse it off with water and shampoo as usual. By doing this, you will be able to remove buildup and residue from your hair strands, resulting in healthier-looking hair.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003C\u002Fol\u003E","paraLength":5,"showRelatedFlag":true,"adsIndex":3},{"htmlText":"\u003Ch2\u003EACV Precautions:\u003C\u002Fh2\u003E","paraLength":5,"showRelatedFlag":false,"adsIndex":3},{"paraLength":5,"showRelatedFlag":false,"adsIndex":3},{"htmlText":"\u003Cul\u003E\u003Cli\u003EIt is not recommended to apply undiluted apple cider vinegar directly to your hair and scalp in order to prevent irritation and damage.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003EIf you have any concerns about allergies, always conduct a patch test before applying apple cider vinegar to your hair.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003EThe use of apple cider vinegar too frequently can cause hair to become dry and damaged.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003Cli\u003EThe use of apple cider vinegar may affect the colour of colour-treated hair, so it is recommended that you consult with a \u003Ckeyword id=\"25273\" type=\"General\" weightage=\"20\" keywordseo=\"hair-care\" source=\"Orion\"\u003Ehair care\u003C\u002Fkeyword\u003E professional before using it.\u003C\u002Fli\u003E\u003C\u002Ful\u003E","paraLength":6,"showRelatedFlag":true,"adsIndex":4},{"htmlText":"There are many benefits to using apple cider vinegar for hair care that are natural and cost-effective. Dandruff can be reduced, hair growth can be increased, and scalp health can be improved by using it. Dia Mirza's Skincare Secret Sometime back, in an interview with Vogue, the actress-turned-producer revealed, \"I also tend to apply what I eat—so if I’m eating an orange, I’ll rub a slice on my face and leave it on for 10 minutes before washing it off. To keep my skin well hydrated and rid it of impurities, I use a natural scrub of walnut, plum and aloe vera and moisturise with either coconut or olive oil.\"For her skincare regime, the actress highlighted using skincare ingredients that are rich in Vitamin C. While there is no doubt that Vitamin C is extremely beneficial for your skin. Here are some DIY home remedies you can try to get flawless skin like Dia Mirza. Benefits of Vitamin C for skin Prevent wrinkles and fine lines.Protection from sun exposure.Provide skin hydration.Aids wound healing.Improves the elasticity of the skin.Lowers dark pigmentation of the skin.Helps to reduce inflammation.DIY Vitamin C Face SerumWash an orange properly and remove the peel. Take a bowl and add rose water. Add the orange peels to rose water and soak them for about 4-5 hours. After that take out the orange peels from the rose water. Then add Vitamin E, glycerin, aloe vera gel and argan oil in orange-infused rose water. Mix everything properly. Take a blending jar. Add soaked orange peels and infused rose water mixture. Blend everything together. Then strain it using a sieve. Pour the serum into a clean bottle. Your own homemade natural Vitamin C serum is ready.Disclaimer: Tips and suggestions mentioned in the article are for general information purposes only and should not be construed as professional advice. It is also known as Tagdola or tender palm fruit, and Nungu. Its consistency is comparable to that of lychee and its flavour to that of soft coconut water.The harsh heat of Indian summers is ideal for tender palm fruit, especially in May and June. The fruit offers a variety of health advantages. With its origin in India, this fruit is believed to taste delicious while quenching one's thirst.    It is known by several different names across the nation such as  Pana Nanguin in Malayalam, Nungu in Tamil, Tari in Hindi, Taal in Bengali, Tadgola in Marathi, Tateningu in Kannada, and Tadfali in Gujarati.Despite having few calories, Ice Apples are nutritious because they are rich in calcium, phytonutrients, and vitamins. This palm fruit is best offered in the summer and is well-known for its health advantages. The fruit, which has the appearance of transparent jelly, is highly nutritious and has a high sugar, vitamin, iron, and calcium content. It also has a great cooling effect. It has a number of health advantages, and regular consumption makes it effective. Ice apples may work wonders for your skin as they cool your body.    Health benefits of ice apple1) Best for diabeticsDiabetic sufferers can safely indulge in Ice Apples.  The palm fruit contains a variety of nutrients that maintain a robust and healthy immune system. A good fruit for managing diabetes, ice apples are rich in vitamins A, C, and B7. Over time, these can strengthen the immune system without significantly increasing calorie intake. It keeps a person satisfied for a long time, preventing blood sugar rises.2) Aids in Weight lossIce apple contains water which helps keep us satisfied, preventing binge eating unhealthy items. They are low in calories, which makes them excellent for weight loss. Frozen apples are a big contributor to weight loss since they are high in dietary fibre, which also helps with digestion.    3) Has anti-ageing propertiesIn addition to having anti-inflammatory and antioxidant characteristics, phytonutrients assist ice apples to fight off free radicals, which helps to delay the onset of ageing.Beauty benefits of Ice applesWith the ingestion of Cold Apples, common summer skin problems like rashes can be avoided.To cure itching and chill and soothe the skin, apply the flesh of an Ice Apple to the troubled regions.The palm fruit prevents dryness and dullness in the hair. It strengthens the hair and functions as a natural conditioner. Ice Apple is a simple solution for heat-related problems such as split ends, early hair ageing, sun damage, and premature baldness. The actress has been praised nationwide for her features and fans have been intrigued to know more about her beauty and skincare secrets in order to get radiant skin like hers.In an Instagram post shared earlier, The Pushpa actress revealed a few secrets about her gorgeous skin. She also highlighted the importance of keeping one's skin healthy from within in order to look clean, fresh and glowing from the outside.                View this post on Instagram            A post shared by Rashmika Mandanna (@rashmika_mandanna) ]]\u003E        The actress also stated in an interview with Pinkvilla  that she prefers having a nutritious diet with lots of greens. She also keeps herself hydrated while double-cleansing her face before going to bed.Here are 7 essential points laid down by Rashmika for healthy and glowing skin:1) Get an allergy testThe Sita Ramam actress explained how Indians can sometimes not be prone to allergies initially but usually crop up later in their lives. '...I am allergic to most veggies like cucumbers & tomatoes & capsicums & even potatoes[(ahhh.. I miss em French fries) but who would’ve thought right] but two years ago my skin was bad.. but I remember I did everything right.. but why is my skin still not clean? So then I got an allergy test & I started ignoring all the foods my body doesn’t accept & today I don’t have that many issues with my skin.. yaaaay!'2) Have a clean mealThe actress also emphasized the importance of knowing one's own body in order to understand what kind of food or products it accepts or repels. '... study your body.. (see how your body reacts to what) cut down on things which you know will make your skin oily...' She also urged netizens to drink at least 2 litres of water to reap its health and beauty benefits.        3) Apply sunscreen dailyMuch has been spoken and written about the benefits of applying sunscreen while stepping out. In fact, it has also been advised to wear sunscreen indoors as well since UV rays can pass through the doors of your glass. 4) Use a Vitamin-C serumRashmika swears by the rejuvenating power of a Vitamin- C serum to work wonders on one's skin. She, however, suggests consulting a dermatologist once before committing to the ingredient.        5) Moisturize your bodyMost people only tend to care about their faces while ignoring the rest of their bodies. The actress urged people to take good care of their bodies by moisturizing them regularly. She also suggests moisturizing the neck and eye area gently for complete moisturization.6) Avoid washing your face multiple timesAll it takes is a complete face wash done twice a day. Avoid using facewash made with harsh ingredients that can make your skin dry. Instead, opt for mild ingredients that do the job of cleansing your face and making it look fresh and glowing.7) Don't over-exfoliateWhile exfoliation is considered to be an important part of every skincare routine, doing it every day can make the skin dry and damage its barrier. Make it a point to exfoliate your lips whenever you can. The actress also suggests not exfoliating on acne-prone skin since it can further worsen the situation.         Found this article helpful? Recent studies have indicated that it is a useful natural remedy for increasing hair growth. The vitamin and mineral content of aloe vera gel helps nourish the scalp and promote healthy hair growth. Here are some tips for using aloe vera gel to grow your hair.Aloe Vera for HairFirst and foremost, you should use fresh aloe vera gel from the plant rather than store-bought products containing chemicals. The gel can be extracted by cutting off a leaf from the aloe vera plant and slicing it open. Use a spoon to scoop out the gel.You can apply aloe vera gel directly to your scalp to promote hair growth. Apply the gel to your scalp with your fingertips and leave it on for 30 to 45 minutes. After rinsing your hair with lukewarm water, shampoo it as usual. You can do this once a week.You can also mix aloe vera gel with other natural ingredients to promote hair growth. If you want to add more nutrition to your aloe vera gel, you can combine it with coconut oil or olive oil. Mix equal parts aloe vera gel and oil and apply it to your scalp and hair. Let it sit for 30 minutes, then rinse with lukewarm water and shampoo as usual. It is recommended to do this once a week.It is also possible to combine aloe vera gel with other natural ingredients such as honey, egg, or yoghurt. Natural humectants like honey help your hair retain moisture. Protein in eggs strengthens hair follicles, while lactic acid in yoghurt exfoliates the scalp and promotes hair growth. Aloe vera gel and honey, eggs, or yoghurt can be mixed together and applied to your hair and scalp. Once it has been applied, leave it for 30 minutes before rinsing off with lukewarm water and shampooing. Ideally, this should be done once a week.Aloe vera is also very instrumental in getting rid of dandruff. Just scoop out some aloe vera gel and mix it with coconut oil mixed with methi. This is one of the most effective ways for getting rid of dandruff and have silky, shiny hair.Aloe vera gel shouldn't be used in place of medical treatment for hair loss. It is important to consult a dermatologist or doctor if you are experiencing excessive hair loss or thinning.Aloe vera gel has other benefits for the hair in addition to promoting hair growth. A dry scalp can be soothed and dandruff can be reduced. Moreover, it adds shine and moisture to the hair, making it look more lustrous and healthy.Aloe vera gel promotes hair growth in a natural and effective way. Whether alone or combined with other natural ingredients, it can be used in a variety of ways. Regular use of aloe vera gel can promote healthy hair growth and nourish the scalp. The best results can be obtained by using fresh aloe vera gel directly from the plant.","cmstype":"ARTICLE","status":"ACTIVE","title":"5 Proven Ways To Apply Aloe Vera Gel For Healthy Hair","cmssource":"CMSLITE","parenttitle":"Lifestyle","titleforurl":"aloe vera gel for hair growth: proven tips and tricks","synopsis":"Aloe vera gel promotes hair growth naturally and effectively. Be it while working in the kitchen, doing household chores, or sitting in front of our laptops and PCs, we have experienced severe back pains more than often in our lives.If we try to figure out the reason we experience backaches often, however, we must keep in mind that back pains are a result of a number of poor habits that build up over time and causes us aches rather than something happening all of a sudden.         Before you set out to book an appointment for physiotherapy, you can make these 5 changes in your life to prevent frequent back pains.1) Leading an active life    Even if you don't wish to engage in intense exercises, make it a point to perform yoga asanas or even some simple stretching to keep your body active. Exercise and drinking water are two behaviours that are crucial for leading a proactive lifestyle. Exercise lowers your chance of developing chronic diseases, raises your mood, and gives you more energy in addition to helping you maintain a healthy weight. Contrarily, drinking water helps your body stay hydrated, supports digestion, and removes pollutants.2) Maintain a proper posture while working    When using a laptop at a desk for extended periods of time, back pain might become more severe. To avoid tilting your chin up when working at the computer, place the screen so that it is at eye level. When using a laptop, raise it to eye level and position an external keyboard and mouse so that your elbows can rest at a 90-degree angle.        3) Balance your load    Make sure you're carrying no more than 10% of your body weight when carrying a bag or handbag. Place heavy goods near the bottom of your bag if you must carry them, and shift your bag back and forth between your shoulders throughout the day.4) Avoid slouching as much as possible    To avoid putting undue strain on your back, it is crucial to stand with your shoulders relaxed and your ears in line with your hips. Bad posture can limit your ability to exercise and promote a sedentary lifestyle by causing back discomfort, decreased flexibility, spinal disc problems, and restricted mobility.        5) Invest in a good mattress    Sleeping on a poor-quality mattress is commonly the main contributor to back pain, often resulting from incorrect spinal alignment and unequal body weight distribution.  Choosing a mattress that is good for back pain helps achieve the perfect blend of comfort and support. It is crucial to spend money on a high-quality mattress to ensure deep and restful sleep as well as to prevent back problems.Found this article helpful? Here are 5 such habits and practices you need to change in order to prevent back aches. From starting her own beauty brand to sharing a skincare and beauty hack or two, beauty enthusiasts, fans, and admirers are in awe of the diva's striking visuals and flawless features.Earlier, the Phone Bhoot actress shared a skincare secret on Instagram that showed her dunking her face into a bowl of ice cubes. While we know that ice cubes as a skincare ingredient have been talked about a million times and that several actresses and beauty influencers have praised and talked about this ingredient, did you know applying ice on your face also gets rid of acne?              View this post on Instagram            A post shared by Katrina Kaif (@katrinakaif) ]]\u003E      Why is ice beneficial for the skin?Reduces puffiness from the faceAlthough there are many potential causes of puffy eyes, lack of sleep and eye strain are the most frequent ones. Ice's ability to lessen swellings causes these bloated sacks to vanish swiftly. Your lovely eyes will recover if you apply cold to the afflicted areas. You might speed up the process by adding a tiny bit of black coffee to your ice cube. Gets rid of dark circlesThe greatest treatment for dark circles would be to apply ice cubes beneath the eyes. Apply ice cubes mixed with cucumber juice to your eye area after the mixture has been frozen. However, this cure does not bring you fast results. For best results, repeat this process daily for a few days.      Makes skin glowApplying ice to your face brightens and increases blood flow to your skin. Additionally, it provides vital nutrients and vitamins and raises the level of oxygen in the skin. Because capillaries are constrained, massaging an ice cube on your face also increases the absorption of your skincare products.Cures acneSince ice cubes relax and soothe inflamed skin and reduce the size of your pores, they are excellent for treating acne. It also decreases the excess sebum production that is the main culprit behind acne.       How to apply ice on your face?Wrap four or five ice cubes in a gentle cotton cloth. Use the ice cubes that have been coated in a cloth to gently massage your face for a few minutes.If you'd like, you can add additional items, like aloe vera or green tea, to your ice cubes in place of the water. Several reports state that ice cubes made with these substances may be able to fine-tune the treatment for specific skin diseases, although more research is required.      Found this article helpful? main.articleBody: A popular Indian snack, bread pakora is loved by all. It is the perfect snack to enjoy during the rainy season with a cup of hot tea or coffee. There is a perfect balance of textures and flavours between the crispy outer layer and the soft bread and spicy filling of the pakora. The following recipe will show you how to make bread pakora at home.Bread Pakora RecipeIngredients:Bread slices (white or brown) - 8Chickpea flour (besan) - 1 cupRice flour - 2 tbspSalt - 1 tspRed chilli powder - 1 tspGaram masala - 1 tspAjwain (carom seeds) - 1 tspBaking soda - 1/2 tspWater - 1 cupOil - for fryingFor the filling:Potatoes - 2 (boiled and mashed)Green chillies - 2 (finely chopped)Coriander leaves - 2 tbsp (finely chopped)Cumin seeds - 1 tspSalt - 1/2 tspGaram masala - 1/2 tspAmchur powder (dry mango powder) - 1/2 tspHow to make Bread PakoraMake the filling by heating oil and adding cumin seeds. After the cumin seeds splutter, add the green chillies and sauté for a minute or two.Then add the mashed potatoes, salt, garam masala, and amchur powder. Combine well and cook for two to three minutes.Turn the heat off and add the coriander leaves. After mixing, let it cool for a few minutes.Slice the bread into halves and cut the edges off.Spread the filling on one side of a slice of bread.Put another slice on top and gently press the slices together.The same process should be repeated with all the slices of bread.Combine besan, rice flour, salt, red chilli powder, garam masala, ajwain, and baking soda in a bowl.To make a smooth batter, add water gradually and whisk.In a deep pan, heat the oil.Dip the bread sandwiches in the besan batter and thoroughly coat them.Place them gently in the hot oil (medium flame) and fry them until golden brown.After removing them from the oil, place them on kitchen towels to absorb excess grease.If you want, you can serve it hot with mint chutney or tomato ketchup.Tips:The filling can be made more nutritious by adding finely chopped onions, carrots, or peas.Don't let the filling become too wet, otherwise the bread will become soggy.Overcrowding the pan will result in uneven cooking of the pakoras.To conclude, bread pakora is a simple and delicious snack that can be made at home with a few simple ingredients. If you are craving something hot and crispy with your cup of tea or coffee on a rainy day, this is the perfect dish for you. Take a bite of bread pakora and indulge in its goodness.
main.headline: Bread Pakora Recipe: Crispy and delicious snack to enjoy on rainy day
main.description: Enjoy this delicious bread pakora recipe on a rainy day. Prepare crispy pakoras with a spicy potato filling using these simple steps. It's perfect to snack on with your morning or evening coffee or tea.
